newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romanian leu stays trapped vs dlr, ignores news.
newsitem.headline: Romanian leu stays trapped vs dlr, ignores news.

text.p: Romania's leu closed locked at 3,155/65 to the dollar on Wednesday in a market unmoved by mixed economic news and president Ion Iliescu's bid for a new term in November polls.
"The market has yet to digest the news. With present hard currency shortages and the market stuck for months I doubt there will be any reaction soon," said a trader with one of the four dealer banks.
Latest statistics show Romanian exports, its main hard currency earner, sank by 16.1 percent to $575.8 million in July, reversing the previous month's rise of 10.3 percent.
But on Wednesday central bank governor Mugur Isarescu said Romania will ease stringent exchange controls imposed earlier this month by excluding most state companies and oil firms from the measures.
"I don't think this makes much difference," said one broker adding that the main problem on the forex market is generated by the artificially firm leu rate against the dollar.
Iliescu, in power since the 1989 fall of communism, officially launches his bid for a fresh term in office at a party rally late on Wednesday.

Operators said trading was lethargic and sporadic with most hard currency sellers unhappy with current rates. Some said they had heard of a fairly significant interbank deal but overall turnover remained scant.

Short-term money market rates closed a shade up near 49 percent from 48 percent in early trading following a rush for leu funds linked with the month's end, when banks should match minimum reserve targets. -- Mirela Eremia, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
